event: Sigma-Aldrich (later to become part of Millipore Sigma) files patent application. Sigma was one of many parties to file a U.S. patent application for the use of CRISPR-Cas9 in eukaryotic cells.

Broad/Harvard/MIT/Rockefeller group files patent application. The Broad/Harvard/MIT/Rockefeller group was the fourth party to file a U.S. patent application for the use of CRISPR-Cas9 in eukaryotic cells.
Church lab publishes paper describing use of CRISPR-Cas9 in human cells

event: Joung group at Massachusetts General Hospital publishes paper using CRISPR-Cas9 in zebrafish

type: working at Institut national de la recherche agronomique
subtype: discovers an unusual CRISPR locus while studying the bacteria streptococcus thermophilus. Although similar to previously reported systems
actors: the CRISPR array discovered would lack some of the known cas genes and instead contained novel cas genes

papers: which is now known as Cas9. Bolotin's team would also note that the spacers

type: opening the door for the tool to be used in medicine.[23][24] In the same month
subtype: a number of other researchers at different laboratories publish papers within a few weeks of each other demonstrating how the CRISPR system could be used to edit genomes in human cells.[15]

event: Leading United Kingdom research organizations issue declare support of the continued use of CRISPR-Cas9 and other genome-editing techniques in preclinical research.[37]
Professor Jennifer Doudna gives a TED Talk about the bioethics of using CRISPR.[38]
The United Kingdom Human Fertilisation and Embryology Authority (HFEA) autorizes researchers get green light to genetically modify human embryos.[44]
American magnate Bill Gates endorses the use of CRISPR technique to create malaria-resistant mosquitoes. By September
type: the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation would plan to double the sum it was spending under the Gates–funded project Target malaria
subtype: to create a mosquito-killing technology that relies on CRISPR gene editing.[49][50][51]

places: when tested in the mdx mouse model of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD)
